conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible interior volume, and an angled/isometric camera showing multiple faces of surfaces.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion and readable room volumes; clean cutaway with consistent wall thickness. Minor simplification in some edge/corner detailing and openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall apartment massing and main adjacencies (3 bedrooms, central living/dining, kitchen/utility zone, terraces) generally match, but bathroom/toilet count and/or placement appears inconsistent with the 2D plan (2D shows 4 toilets; 3D render seems to show fewer/merged). Some balcony/terrace extents and doorway placements are simplified.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (beds, sofa set, dining table), kitchen elements present, bathroom fixtures visible in at least some wet areas. Some rooms (e.g., maid/home office) are simplified and not fully detailed versus the 2D plan.

visual_clarity.notes: Clear separation of walls/floors/openings, good lighting and readability, coherent materials. No obvious broken meshes; presentation clean.

detected_errors.description: At least one toilet/bathroom from the 2D plan appears missing or merged in the 3D render (2D indicates four distinct toilets).
Some layout elements (wet-area partitions/balconies) appear proportionally simplified or altered relative to the 2D plan.
Door/window/opening positions and sizes are simplified; not all openings visibly correspond to the 2D plan.

summary: A clearly valid 3D cutaway with strong volumetric conversion, but with notable layout fidelity issues around the number/definition of toilets and some simplified openings/balconies.
